item.title: Michelle add a quote by Bertolt Brecht
item.description: "Hungry man, reach for the book: it is a weapon." -- Bertolt Brecht

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Kitty O'Neil
item.description: "What I'm looking for is a Blessing NOT in disguise!" -- Kitty O'Neil

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "It is not doing the thing we like to do, but liking the thing we have to do, that makes life blessed." -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Robert Crais
item.description: "The Los Angeles River is small, but mean. People who don't know the truth of it make fun of our river; all they see is a tortured trickle that snakes along a concrete gutter like some junkie's vein. They don't know that we put the river in concrete to save ourselves; they don't know that the river is small because it's sleeping, and that every year and sometimes more it wakes. Before we put the river in that silly trough centered on a concrete plain at the bottom of those concrete walls, it flashed to life with the rain to wash away trees and houses and bridges, and cut its banks to breed new channels almost as if it was looking for people to kill. It found what it looked for too many times. Now, when it wakes, the river climbs those concrete walls so high that wet claws rake the freeways and bridges as it tries to pull down a passing car or someone caught out in the storm. Chain-link fences and barbed wire spine along the top of the walls to keep out people, but the walls keep in the river. The concrete is a prison. The prison works, most of the time." -- Robert Crais

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Our lives begin to end the day we become silent about things that matter." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Elizabeth Cady Stanton
item.description: "The moment we begin to fear the opinions of others and hesitate to tell the truth that is in us, and from motives of policy are silent when we should speak, the divine floods of light and life no longer flow into our souls." -- Elizabeth Cady Stanton

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Mark Nepo
item.description: "Whatever truth we feel compelled to withhold, no matter how unthinkable it is to imagine ourselves telling it, not to is a way of spiritually holding our breath. You can only do it for so long." -- Mark Nepo

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose. You're on your own. And you know what you know. And YOU are the one who'll decide where to go..." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Grace Slick
item.description: "Feed your head" means read a book." -- Grace Slick

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Grace Slick
item.description: "Through literacy you can begin to see the universe. Through music, you can reach anybody. Between the two, there is you, unstoppable." -- Grace Slick

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Edward Albee
item.description: "You're alive only once, as far as we know, and what could be worse than getting to the end of your life and realizing you hadn't lived it?" -- Edward Albee

item.title: Michelle add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself." -- George Bernard Shaw
